fairy_sparklers.name: Fairy Sparklers
fairy_sparklers.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

fairy_sparklers.name: Air Bomb
fairy_sparklers.description: Any shell effect launched from a firework that bangs, normally loudly.

fairy_sparklers.name: Blockbuster
fairy_sparklers.description: A popular and long-running shell effect candle by Vulcan which became the standard against which most 28-30mm candles have been judged in the noughties

fairy_sparklers.name: Cake
fairy_sparklers.description: A multi-shot firework in which the effects or shells are placed in tubes so they are aligned in a horizontal plane.

fairy_sparklers.name: Cherry Bomb
fairy_sparklers.description: The American equivalent of our old garden banger, shaped like a cherry.

fairy_sparklers.name: DIY Kit
fairy_sparklers.description: A kit (sold normally by mail order) comprising of numerous loose items to make a complete display.

fairy_sparklers.name: Ember
fairy_sparklers.description: A burning piece of casing or paper from a firework

fairy_sparklers.name: Indoor Firework
fairy_sparklers.description: A small firework which can be safely lit indoors.

fairy_sparklers.name: Loose Items
fairy_sparklers.description: In firework catalogues, single fireworks not part of a larger pack or kit.

fairy_sparklers.name: Mulit-shot
fairy_sparklers.description: A firework that has more than one shot.

fairy_sparklers.name: Rocket
fairy_sparklers.description: A firework that takes off and displays its effect in the air.

fairy_sparklers.name: Shell
fairy_sparklers.description: An effect ejected from a firework typically into the air where it “breaks” into an effect.

fairy_sparklers.name: Thunderflash
fairy_sparklers.description: A pyrotechnic device that, once activated, explodes with a loud bang and a flash. Used in theatrics, combat training or battle simulations.

fairy_sparklers.name: Yaccy Gum
fairy_sparklers.description: A very common organic fuel and occasionally a binding component in modern firework compositions
